title: Sunny Sunday, cool and wet on Monday
content: WEBVTT ANNOUNCER: NOW, FIRST ALERT WEATHER WITH METEOR ERIC -- METEOROLOGIST ERIC WEGLARZ. WE WENT FROM STICKY COMMITTEE AND RAIN SHOWERS AND NOW WE ARE TALKING SUNSHINE AND LOWER HUMIDITY. RIGHT NOW, A LOT OF LOW HANGING CLOUDS. THESE BEGIN TO PEEL OFF AS THE MORNING GOES ON. THE WIND STARTING TO RAMP UP AS WELL. WIND COMING OUT OF THE NORTH AND DRIER AIR MUCH -- EXPECTED. 65 IN HYDE PARK. 62 IN SCHUYLER FALLS AND ADDISON. COOLER AIR IS LINGERING TO THE NORTH, BUT A LOT OF SPOTS ARE UNIFORM IN THE MID-60’S. STORMTRACKER SHOWING THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUDS RIGHT NEAR PSARANAC LAKE TOWARDS PLATTSBURG . EXPECT CLEARING IN THE NEXT 45 MINUTES TO ONE HOUR. A FEW SHOWERS WILL DRY UP AS THE MORNING GOES ON. MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRYER TODAY. YOU DO. DAY. AND THEN WE REVERSE AND GO TO A MORE UNSETTLED PATTE. WE SEE A FEW STORM SYSTEMS APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH AND WEST. THIS AFTERNOON PASSED IT -- FANTASTIC. HIGHS CLIMBED TO THE MID TO UPPER 70’S IN MANY SPOTS. 74 IN LYNDONVILLE. 72 IN LYNDONVILLE. TOWARDS THE SOUTH, TEMPERATURES IN THE MID TO UPPER 70’S, EVEN THOUGH 80’S IN SOME SPOTS. TONIGHT, CLEAR SKIES. THINGS COOL OFF NICELY. THAT TREND CONTINUES THROUGH SUNDAY WITH NOT A LOT OF CLOUDS. LOWS TONIGHT IN SARANAC LAKE IN THE UPPER 30’S. MID TO UPPER 40’S FOR MANY SPOTS , EVEN FLIRTING WITH 50 DEGREES IN PLACES LIKE RUTLAND. FIVE-DAY FORECAST, THE SHOWER THREAT MONDAY AND TUESDAY. HIGHS ARE CHILLY IN THE LOW TO MID-60’S ALL THE WAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY. THURSDAY, WE DRY OUT. MORE SUNSHINE. HI
